title: 2018 Americas Rugby Championship squads
text:
This is a list of the complete squads for the <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">2018 Americas Rugby Championship</a>, an annual <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> tournament contested by <a href="Argentina%20XV%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina XV</a>, <a href="Brazil%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Brazil</a>, <a href="Canada%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a>, <a href="Chile%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Chile</a>, <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States</a> and <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguay</a>. Argentina XV are the defending champions.
Note: Number of caps and players' ages are indicated as of 27 January 2018 – the tournament's opening day.
Argentina XV.
Argentina XV squad for the <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">2018 Americas Rugby Championship</a>.
1 Following the start of the Super Rugby, Contepomi called up players as cover for their professional contingent.
Head Coach: <a href="Felipe%20Contepomi">Felipe Contepomi</a>
Brazil.
Brazil's 26-man squad for the <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">2018 Americas Rugby Championship</a>.
1 After recovering from injury, Endy Willian rejoined the squad ahead of the second round.
2 After recovering from injury, Stefano Giantorno joined the squad for the final two rounds, whilst Daniel Lima joined the squad as injury cover.
Head Coach: <a href="Rodolfo%20Ambrosio">Rodolfo Ambrosio</a>
Canada.
Canada's 35-man extended squad ahead of Canada's <a href="2019%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20%E2%80%93%20Americas%20qualification">2019 RWC Qualifiers</a> against <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguay</a> (doubles up as ARC Round 1) and for the reaming ARC rounds post qualification matches.
1 Following the conclusion of the RWC Qualifiers between Canada and Uruguay, Canada called up players to cover the professional players returning to their European clubs.
2 Jones added Ryan Kotlewski and Cam Polson to the squad for the final two rounds.
3 Noah Barker was a late call up to the fourth round games against Argentina XV.
4Josh Thiel was added for the final round as injury cover.
Head Coach: <a href="Kingsley%20Jones%20%28rugby%20union%2C%20born%201969%29">Kingsley Jones</a>
Chile.
Chile's 45-man extended squad for the <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">2018 Americas Rugby Championship</a>.
1 Nicolás Garafulic was a late addition to the training squad ahead of the ARC.
Head Coach: <a href="Mark%20Cross%20%28rugby%20union%29">Mark Cross</a>
United States.
On 4 January 2018, newly appointed head coach Gary Gold announced a 39-man squad for the <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">2018 Americas Rugby Championship</a>.
1 Chris Baumann rejoined the squad following his recovering stint with his club in Europe.
Head Coach: <a href="Gary%20Gold">Gary Gold</a>
Uruguay.
On 11 January 2018, Meneses named a 26-man squad ahead of Uruguay's <a href="2019%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20%E2%80%93%20Americas%20qualification">2019 RWC Qualifiers</a> against <a href="Canada%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a> (doubles up as ARC Round 1) and for the reaming ARC rounds post qualification matches.
1 Following the conclusion of the RWC Qualifiers between Canada and Uruguay, Uruguay called up several players to for the remaining games in the ARC.
Head Coach: <a href="Esteban%20Meneses">Esteban Meneses</a>
